snippet: Dr. Michael Phillips, the director of NYU Langone Medical Center’s infection prevention and control unit, knows that at any time someone might appear carrying a dangerous virus.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column focuses on Dr Michael S Phillips, director of infection prevention and control unit at NYU Langone Medical Center in Manhattan; notes Phillips is constantly prepared for possible outbreaks of illnesses like Ebola and was drawn in part to work in New York City due to its diversity of infectious ailments.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Michael Phillips, the director of NYU Langone Medical Center’s infection prevention and control unit, knows that at any time someone might appear carrying a dangerous virus.

headline.main: Without Breaking a Sweat, a Doctor Tracks Ebola and Other Epidemics
headline.print_headline: Without Breaking a Sweat, a Doctor Tracks Ebola and Other Epidemics
